Description: Earthdawn 4 Custom data for the Steps project

Knacks.Name: Battle Brother  [Path]

Requirements.Text: Must complete a Battle Brother ordeal (not tested)

Knacks.Description: The adept performs the initiation ritual and weaves a thread to the Battle Brother pattern, taking 2 Blood Magic Damage, and gains Battle Brother at rank 1.

Knacks.Name: Tail Dancer (K'stulaamoyna)  [Path]

Requirements.Text: Must complete a Tail Dancer ordeal (not tested)

Knacks.Description: The adept performs the initiation ritual and weaves a thread to the Tail Dancer pattern, taking 2 Blood Magic Damage, and gains Tail Dancer at rank 1.

Knacks.Name: Heroes’ Respite [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on any Charisma-based test when trying to calm or encourage people in difficult times or after a battle. This does not include Talents used in battle.

Knacks.Name: Honour! Valor! Glory! [Karma
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on their Imbue Ancestral Weapon test.

Knacks.Name: For Victory! [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on a Inspire Others, Rally or Tactics test. When using the knack, the Adept’s voice is magically amplified to sound like a much larger group speaking in unison.

Knacks.Name: Lest We Forget [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on any test after witnessing an ally fall in battle (e.g. unconscious or dead), until the end of combat. This knack can be used once per round, per fallen ally, but only one Karma may be added to each test.

Knacks.Name: No Guts, No Glory [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on an ally’s Attack test (not including Spellcasting), as long as the ally is within rank x5 yards and fighting at the front. Only Close Combat and Throwing attacks can benefit from this knack. The Adept can use this knack Battle Brother rank times per round.

Knacks.Name: The Ol’ One-Two [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on an Attack or Damage test against a target that has already been damaged by themselves or an ally this round. This knack may be used once per round.

Knacks.Name: Taleteller’s Memory [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point any test to learn or recall information about Legends and Heroes, Ancient Weapons or Military History.

Knacks.Name: War Master [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend a Karma Point on an ally’s damage test (not including spells), as long as the ally is within rank x5 yards of them and fighting at the front. Only Close Combat and Throwing attacks can benefit from this knack. The Adept can use this knack Battle Brother rank times per round.

Knacks.Name: One-Blade Juggle
Knacks.Description: Instead of juggling multiple weapons, the Adept throws their main weapon into the air where it splits into another copy of itself, adding another copy with every bounce. For each success another copy of their weapon is added, further increasing their defenses.

Knacks.Name: Stormfront
Knacks.Description: The Battle Brother assumes an open stance with secure footing, forgoing the defensive properties of Blade Juggle to instead create a storm of blades in front of them. They make a Stormfront test against a difficulty number of their main weapon’s size + 3. If successful, their weapon will arc with electricity and begin to spin in wild patterns as if instilled with a life of their own, seeking out any enemy within throwing range in front of the Adept. For each success, a sparkling copy of their weapon will appear and join its physical counterpart in the Stormfront.

Knacks.Name: Ancestral Barrage
Knacks.Description: The runes and symbols on the adept’s imbued weapon glow with incomparable intensity, as the adept spins up their arms before delivering a deadly barrage, their weapon splitting into multiple copies to rain down on their enemies.

Knacks.Name: Perplex
Knacks.Description: The Battle brother has mastered the art of distracting their opponents. Be it through their thundering voice overshadowing all other sounds or the sheer absurdity of their tales, their target will be left in utter perplexity while being unable to focus on anybody else. Targets affected by the Perplex knack also suffer an equal penalty to their mystic and social defense against attacks from other characters.

Knacks.Name: Dying Creed
Knacks.Description: Should the Adept die heroically in a battlefield where no witnesses remain, their spirit will be bound to their place of death. After a year and a day, the spirit will manifest and wait in place until they meet someone to whom they may tell the tales of those who died laid down their life in this place. The spirit will ask those who have found them to carry their tale to the Order. If those who found the spirit deliver their tale, the spirit will move on to find eternal rest – the magic of their Path letting the spirit know that their tale has been delivered.

Knacks.Name: What Dwells Within
Knacks.Description: Instead of gaining information about other’s emotional state, the Battle Brother can telegraph their own emotions to those around them. They make a What Dwells Within test against the highest Social Defense among a targeted crowd, modified by +2 for every attitude level of the crowd below friendly (+2 for Neutral, +4 for Unfriendly, etc.). If successful, everyone targeted will know the general emotional state of the Battle Brother. Two successes allow them to reinforce the depth of their emotions and three or more successes leaving no doubt among those targeted that what they perceive is the exact emotional state of the adept. The adept also gains a +2 bonus per success on the next Interaction test to make an impression with the targeted crowd, or any of its members.

Knacks.Name: Propelled by Legend
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. The Adept loudly invokes the name of one of their Ancestors when making their attack, channeling the power of the Ancestor’s Legend into their attack. They may add their Charisma Step to any Damage tests made with Throwing Weapons when using Heroic Throw.

Knacks.Name: Ancestral Bulwark
Knacks.Description: The Adept has learned to imbue their shield with their ancestors’ power by making an Ancestral Bulwark (6) test. If successful, the Adept’s shield becomes covered in symbols unique to the Adept and their ancestors. The Adept gains a +1 bonus per additional success to any Avoid Blow test when using their shield to block and the difficulty for any attempt to break or disarm their shield is increased by the Ancestral Bulwark rank. The effect lasts Ancestral Bulwark Rank rounds and counts as an active instance of Imbue Ancestral Weapon.

Knacks.Name: At First Light
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. Battle Brothers are taught to always be ready, storming into battle at first notice, bellowing a glorious tale. At the cost of 2 Strain, the Adept can use the Inspire Others Talent as a Simple action during the first round of combat.

Knacks.Name: Inspire Legion
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. The difficulty number of Inspire Others no longer increases with the number of additional targets, but it will no longer increase Social Defense and the bonus to tests is reduced to +1 per success.

Knacks.Name: So Many Tales Left to Tell!
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. The Adept may add their Battle Brother Rank to their Life Check step.

Knacks.Name: Stand Up, To Glory!
Knacks.Description: The Adept has the chance to save the life of one of their peers, allowing them to continue fighting to reach greater heights. By taking strain equal to their Wound Threshold, incurring a wound, the Adept can transfer the use of their Life Check talent to another Namegiver who has fought and fallen by their side. The target of this knack can make a single enhanced Recovery Test as if they had Life Check, by adding the talent rank and Toughness Step of the donor to their own Recovery Test Step.

Knacks.Name: Breach Attack
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. If the Adept attacked with a weapon affected by Imbue Ancestral Weapon, they may throw it at a target within range instead of making another close combat attack. This Knack cannot be used in the same round as Momentum Attack.

Knacks.Name: Second Assault
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. If the Adept has an active instance of Ancestral Weapon, they may throw their weapon at a target within range and return it. This Knack may not be used in the same round as Second Attack.

Knacks.Name: Double Throw
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. If the Adept has an active instance of Ancestral Weapon, they may instead throw their second weapon at a target in range and return it to their hand. This Knack cannot be used with a shield and may not be used in the same round as Second Weapon.

Knacks.Name: Attack in the Aftermath
Knacks.Description: When attacking a target that is currently afflicted by a negative effect with a duration (excluding poisons) or in an otherwise disadvantageous position (Knocked Down, Harried, Surprised, etc.), each additional success on the Adept’s Attack Test will increase the Damage Step by +3 instead of +2.  If another effect grants them the same bonus, increase the extra damage steps by another +1 per additional successes. Using this Knack costs 1 Strain per Damage test and does not count as using a knack for any limitations.

Knacks.Name: Bide Time
Knacks.Description: The Adept may choose to forgo the bonus from a talent that lasts for a single round and instead benefit from its bonus in the next round. This does not override the initial requirements of any talents, such as needing higher initiative for Anticipate Blow. Can be used once per round and does not count as using a knack for any limitations.

Knacks.Name: The Last Stand [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Battle Brother Orders their allies to make a Last Stand. By paying 2 Strain each, the Adept can spend additional successes on a Tactics test to allow their allies to ignore the negative effects of one wound for the duration of the talent, allowing them to keep fighting no matter how severe their injuries may be. Each additional success spent also allows them to fight for a single round while beyond their Unconscious Rating, while the talent is still in effect. This does not wake up allies who are already Unconscious and does not stack with Resist Pain.

Knacks.Name: Dying Creed
Knacks.Description: Should the Adept die heroically in a battlefield where no witnesses remain, their spirit will be bound to their place of death. After a year and a day, the spirit will manifest and wait in place until they meet someone to whom they may tell the tales of those who died laid down their life in this place. The spirit will ask those who have found them to carry their tale to the Order. If those who found the spirit deliver their tale, the spirit will move on to find eternal rest – the magic of their Path letting the spirit know that their tale has been delivered.

Knacks.Name: Emotion Song
Knacks.Description: Like the Talent

Knacks.Name: Go for the Eyes! [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can spend two additional successes on an Attack test to inflict Partial Blindness on the target until the end of the next round. If the target is affected by this ability again in the same conflict, it applies Full Blindness instead. If the damage causes a wound, the blindness lasts until the wound is healed.

Knacks.Name: Kneecapper [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can spend two additional successes on an Attack test with a throwing weapon to reduce the target’s movement rate by half, until the end of the next round. If the attack inflicts a wound, the penalty lasts until the wound is healed. This knack can be used multiple times and effectively reduce a targets movement rate to a minimum of 1.

Knacks.Name: Sundering Strike [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can spend two additional successes on a Throwing Weapons test to instead sunder the opponent’s armor, reducing its physical armor by 2. The weapon must be under effect of Imbue Ancestral Weapon. This may not destroy thread armor.

Knacks.Name: Weight of Legend [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can spend two additional success on a Throwing Weapons test to force the opponent to make a Knockdown test against a DN equal to the Attack test result. If failed, the enemy will be knocked down, pinned to the ground by the adept’s weapon. The duration is until the end of the next round, +1 round for every two additional successes over the enemy’s Knockdown test – or until the adept recalls their weapon. The weapon must be under effect of Imbue Ancestral Weapon.

Knacks.Name: Dance of Syrtis
Knacks.Description: Standard Effects. The Adept may substitute their Dance of Syrtis Step for their Dexterity Step when making their Initiative test while gliding. This knack may be combined with other knacks.

Knacks.Name: Tempest Dance
Knacks.Description: After splitting their movement to attack a different target, the Adept may once again compare their initiative with that of the new target to potentially gain an extra attack against them. Every additional attack gained this way costs 2 Strain and each target can only be attacked once this way. This knack may be combine with other knacks and can be used multiple times per round.

Knacks.Name: Leaf in the Wind
Knacks.Description: The Adept may use the Splitting Movement combat option without penalty while Gliding, up to a number of times per round equal to their Leaf in the Wind rank. Each opponent attacked this way costs 1 additional Strain. This does not increase their movement rate while gliding but they may use the Fly-By Special Maneuver without spending extra successes.

Knacks.Name: Controlled Plummet
Knacks.Description: The Adept may use their Gliding talent to resist Knockdown effects while Gliding. They must be at least 4 yards above ground and land immediately after using this knack. This knack acts the same way as the Wound Balance Talent (PG p. 181).

Knacks.Name: Fly-By [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: By spending 2 extra successes from their Gliding test, the Adept may perform a Swooping Attack and regain up to half the vertical distance they have glided downward to make their Swooping Attack. However, they must travel downwards for at least 4 yards and are still limited by their movement rate.

Knacks.Name: Squirrel Glide [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can quickly change directions while in mid-air, performing almost impossible twists and turns. They may spend an extra success from a Gliding test to use the Splitting Movement combat option an additional time in the next round. They are still limited by their movement rate and must pay the Strain cost each time they use the Splitting Movement combat option.

Knacks.Name: Reckless Dive [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept may spend additional successes from a Gliding test to add +2 to their Initiative test in the next round. This bonus is lost if the Adept lands before the next Initiative is determined.

Knacks.Name: K’stulaamoyna Updraft [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: When using Great Leap to jump into the air, the Adept can spend an extra success from their K’stulaamoyna Dance to immediately gain 2 additional yards of height and add +2 to their Movement Rate for determining their maximum vertical movement on a subsequent Gliding test.

Knacks.Name: Gale Strike [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The adept may spend 2 extra successes from the K’stulaamoyna Dance test and take 2 Strain to reduce the number of successes required to gain the extra attack from Air Dance by 1 until the end of the round. The additional attack can also be made during their turn.

Knacks.Name: Squirrel Dance [Special Maneuver]
Knacks.Description: The Adept’s dance will incorporate nimble movements of the flying squirrels, who live around the House of Spirit Wind. The Adept can spend an extra success on a K’stulaamoyna Dance test to avoid being harried from Splitting their Movement while on the ground.

Knacks.Name: K’stulaamoyna Cyclone
Knacks.Description: The final Damage bonus at the end of the round will be added as a bonus to the Adept’s next Initiative test. This bonus is lost if they are Knocked Down or otherwise incapacitated when the new initiative is determined.

Knacks.Name: Swept by the Wind [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The adept can spend a Karma Point on an Attack test using the Tail Attack combat option. This knack can be used once per turn.

Knacks.Name: Syrtis’ Boon [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The Adept can spend a Karma Point on Gliding tests.

Knacks.Name: Wind Dance [Karma]
Knacks.Description: The adept can spend a Karma Point on Dance talents and Dancing skill.

Knacks.Name: Wings of Death
Knacks.Description: They make a Wings of Death (15) test as a free action before Initiative is determined, as small air currents begin to condense around their hands and tail. If successful, their weapons will be surrounded by visible wisps of wind, guiding their strikes and allowing them to treat any opponents within 12 yards as being within close combat range until the end of the round.

Knacks.Name: K’stulaamoyna Combat Training
Knacks.Description: The Adept has been trained in the usage of the Hawk Hatchet, learning how to properly wield them with their tail. After paying the Strain as Blood Magic Damage upon learning this knack, they may treat Hawk Hatchets and Dancing Blades as Size 2 weapons when wielding them with their Tail. Using this knack is not considered to be using the associated talent. Additionally, when the Adept can use their Tail Attack combat option, they may attack with Melee Weapons in the same round. They must be wielding a Hawk Hatchet or Dancing Blade with their tail.

Knacks.Name: Fling Tail
Knacks.Description: The Adept may use Throwing Weapons when using the Tail Attack option, if they are wielding a Hawk Hatchet or Dancing Blade with their tail. They may not perform any other additional attacks with their tail that round.

Knacks.Name: Hawk Hatchet Mastery
Knacks.Description: The Adept has achieved mastery of both Hawk Hatchets and Dancing Blades and gains the ability to infuse their weapons with a will of their own. Attacks will cut and tear flesh, but they never strike a target dead-on. Their weapons will wind their way through the thick of battle, always returning to them after being thrown  The Adept performs a modified Karma Ritual during which they make a shallow cut on themselves with each of their weapons, taking the 3 point of Strain as Blood Damage. All attacks with Hawk Hatchets and Dancing Blades will count as if they have the Returning knack. This knack lasts until sunrise the next day, at which point the Adept can heal the damage.

Ranks.Effect: Trail of Sparkles: Simple action, 1 Strain. When the wearer moves at least half of their (or their mount’s) Movement Rate, sparkling light spills forth, leaving long contrails behind the wearer. The wearer gains +3 to any Knockdown Difficulties in close combat until the end of the turn

Sparkle Strike: Simple action, 1 Strain. When the wearer moves at least half of their (or their mount’s) Movement Rate, sparkling light spills forth, leaving long contrails behind the wearer. The wearer gains +3 to any Knockdown Difficulties in close combat until the end of the turn, and the first attack of the users round gains +3 damage

Sparkle Strike: Simple action, 1 Strain. When the wearer moves at least half of their (or their mount’s) Movement Rate, sparkling light spills forth, leaving long contrails behind the wearer. The wearer gains +3 to any Knockdown Difficulties in close combat until the end of the turn, and the first attack of the users round gains +3 damage
Sparkle Shower: In addition to Sparkle Strike, +1 strain, the users first attack gains 2m radius AOE, dealing half the rolled damage to all eligible targets in the area with no separate hit roll
